channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Fineract
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Fineract

item.title: CVE-2017-5663|2024-08-05T15:11:48.791Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description: In Apache Fineract 0.4.0-incubating, 0.5.0-incubating, and 0.6.0-incubating, an authenticated user with client/loan/center/staff/group read permissions is able to inject malicious SQL into SELECT queries. The 'sqlSearch' parameter on a number of endpoints is not sanitized and appended directly to the query.

item.title: CVE-2018-1289|2024-08-05T03:59:37.666Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description: In Apache Fineract versions 1.0.0, 0.6.0-incubating, 0.5.0-incubating, 0.4.0-incubating, the system exposes different REST end points to query domain specific entities with a Query Parameter 'orderBy' and 'sortOrder' which are appended directly with SQL statements. A hacker/user can inject/draft the 'orderBy' and 'sortOrder' query parameter in such a way to read/update the data for which he doesn't have authorization.

item.title: CVE-2018-1292|2024-08-05T03:59:37.977Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description: Within the 'getReportType' method in Apache Fineract 1.0.0, 0.6.0-incubating, 0.5.0-incubating, 0.4.0-incubating, a hacker could inject SQL to read/update data for which he doesn't have authorization for by way of the 'reportName' parameter.

item.title: CVE-2018-1290|2024-08-05T03:59:37.618Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description: In Apache Fineract versions 1.0.0, 0.6.0-incubating, 0.5.0-incubating, 0.4.0-incubating, Using a single quotation escape with two continuous SQL parameters can cause a SQL injection. This could be done in Methods like retrieveAuditEntries of AuditsApiResource Class and retrieveCommands of MakercheckersApiResource Class.

item.title: CVE-2018-1291|2024-08-05T03:59:37.637Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description: Apache Fineract 1.0.0, 0.6.0-incubating, 0.5.0-incubating, 0.4.0-incubating exposes different REST end points to query domain specific entities with a Query Parameter 'orderBy' which are appended directly with SQL statements. A hacker/user can inject/draft the 'orderBy' query parameter by way of the "order" param in such a way to read/update the data for which he doesn't have authorization.

item.title: CVE-2024-23537|2024-03-29T14:38:05.738Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description:
Improper Privilege Management vulnerability in Apache Fineract.This issue affects Apache Fineract: <1.8.5.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.9.0, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-23538|2024-03-29T14:37:40.374Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description:
Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in Apache Fineract.This issue affects Apache Fineract: <1.8.5.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.8.5 or 1.9.0, which fix the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-23539|2024-03-29T14:36:57.919Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description:
Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in Apache Fineract.This issue affects Apache Fineract: <1.8.5.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.8.5 or 1.9.0, which fix the issue.

item.description:
Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection') vulnerability in Apache Fineract.This issue affects Apache Fineract: <1.8.5.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.8.5 or 1.9.0, which fix the issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-23537|2024-07-08T20:06:52.390Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20fineract
item.description:

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.9.0, which fixes the issue.
